meanings.definition: To remove from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The new election unseats the current mayor.
meanings.sent2: The board unseats the CEO due to misconduct.
meanings.sent3: The clever plan unseats the king from his throne.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected scandal unseats the powerful politician.
meanings.sent5: The revolution unseats the oppressive regime.

meanings.definition: To cause to fall from a seat or saddle.
meanings.sent1: The sudden stop unseats the passenger on the bus.
meanings.sent2: The rough terrain unseats the rider from the horse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous prank unseats the unsuspecting friend.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind unseats the umbrella from its stand.
meanings.sent5: The playful dog unseats the child from the swing.

meanings.definition: To dislodge or throw from a seat or saddle.
meanings.sent1: The jolt unseats the driver from his seat.
meanings.sent2: The sudden movement unseats the performer from the unicycle.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy road unseats the passenger from the bicycle.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn unseats the cowboy from the horse.
meanings.sent5: The playful push unseats the child from the chair.
